title: [COMPLETED]Network Maintenance - 24/04/2015
body:
Summoners,

At 02:30 AEST 24/04/2015 Ranked Queues will be disabled in preparation for Network Maintenance. At 04:00 AEST we will begin completing the maintenance.

This is a two part effort in our continual strive to provide a stable service to you:
1. Help identify the underlying cause of the network interruption that occurred in the early hours of 22/04/2015 AEST.
2. Continue and complete the network maintenance that was scheduled on 22/04/2015.

**Update:**
Due to some issues we were not able to perform the maintenance has originally scheduled on 23/04/2015, this has now been updated to occur on 24/04/2015.

24/04/2015 - Maintenance has been completed and all network traffic should now be returning to normal. If you are experiencing high pings please head over to http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs and follow the instructions to run some diagnostics and submit the reports to us.

24/04/2015 16:00 - Thank you to everyone that has been submitting their diagnostic results to us, we have been analyzing the data that we have been receiving and completing tests on our end to try and diagnose the issue. At this stage it appears one of our Internet Providers is routing traffic in a sub optimally way for a number of players in New Zealand. We are currently reaching out to said ISP to work with their engineers to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. Again thank you to everyone that has submitted their results.

24/05/2015 19:00 - We believe we may of solved the issue with players experiencing high ping. Please complete the diagnostic tool above if you are still experiencing it.

-ToxicHawk

Im with spark, and am still getting high ping. I usually sit at 35, but its now been at 160 constantly.

And I have done plenty of ping tests, they're all normal, just when it comes to LoL its going up. Why can you guys never keep things the same? It was fine.

riot pls fix this asap... getting some LOL withdrawals here! i NEED my rank que fix!!!
My ping is ussauly around 40-60 but after patch 5.6 it went to 80-100 and now after 5.7 it is at a constant 200. I have checked with my ISP and nothing is wrong there so it must be the servers...

The same for me..its quite frustrating..i have checked with my isp as well..used to be 50-60 now its constant 206-212 :(
Im usually at 45ms last night i was at 170 first game this morning is not at 200 wtf rito{{item:3070}}

Yeah I'm in East Aus and usually my ping is around 36 but ever since about patch 5.6 I've had huge lag spikes and lots of A2R. I'm with Telstra and worked hard to see if it was them, but they switched us over to another band and did other things to our account, which didn't fix the issue, so it's, as always (even though they don't want to admit it) on RIOT's end.

Really, Ever since patch 4.13 in summer of 2013-14 the server hasn't been up to scratch, as confirmed by;

> _Posted by: StÃ¼dmuffin 
> I work IT, so I have a decent idea about what I'm doing when it comes to troubleshooting connectivity.
>  The problem y'all are talking about is happening to me, too, and it absolutely started when Riot had us download 4.13 -- don't worry, it's really not a problem on your end, even if you talk to a Riot support employee via support ticket and they try to tell you that it is (this has happened to me before, and it really made me want to /facepalm when I read the support ticket's response -_- ).
_I'm reasonably certain that it all links back to the DDoS attacks Riot was sustaining back in the early months of 2014. It's disheartening to me that I haven't been able to find any public notice about how they dealt with it. My hunch is that they started to ban certain ISPs as a way to triage the problem -- it'd be a much cheaper, resource-wise, solution than, say, upgrading their own security protocols server-side.
If there are any Riot employees reading this thread, please: I'd love a statement about what the server team's response was in the aftermath of the DDoS attacks, and whether or not your team considers it a closed case. I'm not afraid of computer lingo in the response, and I'd wager a bunch of RP (maybe, say, the $300 worth I bought during the sale just before I started to have major connection issues, preventing me from really enjoying my purchase -- you can check my sales record against the sharp change in my login record if you want to confirm this) that a whole host of League fans also wouldn't balk at such an explanation. Rather, we'd appreciate Riot's forthrightness in addressing what appears to be an ongoing issue.
</3_

Read the whole thread (which started about the lack of server communication between WTFast and LoL clients - which is still an issue) here:

you are right they don't do shit about it...been waiting for so long nothing has been done....helloo dota 2 i guess

The problem is, sydney and alot of places along the coast have gotten smashed by bad weather, parts of N.S.W have been declared natural disaster areas and as such, alot of people are using the network as a means of communication.

when we take this into account along with the fact the network has been impaired by service issues (broken lines, water getting into the copper network along with other issues it just continues to snowball.

Personally i think riot has done well to keep things going despite this.

i wonder by when  they will fix it
god knows look at the american issue they had with ping thats been going on for over 3 months

Usually my ping only around 130-150 but this time its above 280... can you tell me why and how to fix this
Note: I'm playing from Indonesia and play on Oceania server

Hi, I'm with iiNet in Canberra and I'm experiencing problems with LoL.  I've submitted my network logs as above.
I am experiencing packet loss and extremely high ping when I have other champions in my vision - I can run a custom game alone and have a stable <40 ping, but when other champions are involved my ping fluctuates wildly, eventually increasing to >1000.  The tracert seems to indicate a bad connection between the iinet route in sydney and Riot's end, since my tracert to google is fine.  (attached my results for example purposes)

Anyone else having these issues?

No idea what's happening, but I cannot get into any games. I know for a fact, (I have checked numerous amounts of times, it's not my internet) my ping is always around 40-60 and when I do get into games it is always around there.

thanks is fix now !

Hey Guys,
Latest update.

We believe the high ping some players were seeing is now fixed. From all the testing we have done we can see latency dropping quite considerably.

We did however see some players get the firewall error while the fix was being implemented, however once they reconnected everything was back to normal.

If you still experience any issues, please use the Network Diagnostic Tool in my original post to submit your results to us.

-ToxicHawk

I've played a game before but the next consecutive game i duoed with my sister the game disconnected. i thought it was just a mac thing but my sister had the same problem running windows. everything worked fine except reconnecting. i messaged one of the other players in the match with a lolchat application on my phone about 20 minutes later who told me the game finished due to a 3v5. just about then i managed to restart the game. my sister ending up with a low priority queue and a loss to her clean placement games. i ended up losing a provisional. whats going on.....
ign: Daracon123 sisters ign: Mooncake9c

Hey Guys,

I have updated the main post with the latest information, but to give a tl;dr.

We have identified a routing issue with one of our ISP's that is causing some NZ players to be routed sub optimally. We are currently reaching out to that ISP to work with their engineers to resolve the issue as quickly as possible.

Thank you to everyone that has been submitting their results as it has helped us to diagnose the issue to this point.

-ToxicHawk

Thank you for your help.

Is the sub-optimal routing related to the storm damage in NSW?

> [{quoted}](name=Kiwifruit,realm=OCE,application-id=3fteLeTW,discussion-id=rLiFIegm,comment-id=000b0001,timestamp=2015-04-24T06:18:47.978+0000)
>
> Thank you for your help.
> 
> Is the sub-optimal routing related to the storm damage in NSW?

We are not sure if it was caused by the storms yet, but is definitely something we are discussing with the engineers.
Yeah NSW got battered hard. Also there's been a 6.0+ earthquake in NZ today; so that might have messed with things.
Good Job, Thank you and good luck fixing it smoothly.
